instruction: What innovative approaches were used in the study to solve the classification issue of different types of raspberry powders based on their polysaccharide content?
Output:
In the study, two innovative approaches were used to solve the classification issue of different types of raspberry powders based on their polysaccharide content. 

The first approach involved the use of Multi-Layer Perceptron Networks (MLPNs) with a set of texture descriptors. MLPNs are a type of artificial neural network that can learn and recognize patterns. In this case, the MLPNs were trained using the texture descriptors of the raspberry powder images obtained from Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM). By analyzing the texture of the images, the MLPNs were able to classify the raspberry powders based on their polysaccharide content.

The second approach utilized Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) with bitmap images. CNNs are a type of deep learning algorithm that are particularly effective in image recognition tasks. In this case, the CNNs were trained using bitmap images of the raspberry powder samples. By analyzing the pixel-level information in the images, the CNNs were able to classify the raspberry powders based on their polysaccharide content.

Both the MLPNs and CNNs were designed to achieve a high efficiency of classification, allowing for the accurate recognition of microparticles and the determination of the homogeneity of raspberry powders based on their image texture.
